full_summary:
**Crawley Creek Bridge Emergency Repairs Request for Proposal**

**Reference:** WS3695928820-Doc3695959277

**Publication Date:** 2022-10-05

**Closing Date:** 2022-10-27T14:00:00

**Tender Status:** Expired

**Introduce**
This Request for Proposal (RFP) invites experienced bridge construction and repair service providers to submit proposals for the emergency repairs of the Crawley Creek Bridge, located on the Canadian Coast Guard College campus, Nova Scotia.

**Background**
Recent inspections revealed significant delamination of the glulam girders of the the bridge. The bridge is a glulam timber pedestrian bridge spanning the creek linking walking trails on the campus and also carries the sanitary sewer line to nearby facilities in Sydney.

**RFP Requirements**

The RFP invites proposals from experienced companies that have self-identified their interest in bidding on the project. The bridge construction and repair service must meet the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) requirements.

**Contract Information**

*   Contracting Entity: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
*   Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5
*   Procurement Category: CSNT
*   UNSPSC Code: 72141107 – Bridge construction and repair service

**Project Details**

*   Expected Contract Start Date: 2022-07-29
*   Project Location: Crawley Creek Bridge, Canadian Coast Guard College campus, Nova Scotia
*   Project Description: Emergency repairs of the glulam girders and sanitary sewer line

**Contact Information**

*   Name: Russell, Alex
*   Title: Procurement Specialist (SPAC/PWGSC) – (he/him)
*   Email: alex.russell@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Notice URL and Attachments**

The notice URL and attachments are not provided at this moment.

Note that the rewritten text omits unnecessary information and includes only relevant details. I ensured the language is professional, clear, and concise. I also kept the original request to 400 words. Let me know how I can improve this output further!
